2b49c8ac829c.title: Thanks! If you’re interested, check out Music Teacher on Alexa.

paragraphs.text: Thanks! If you’re interested, check out Music Teacher on Alexa. It gives beginner lessons for the piano. Just basic note instructions and how to play a few songs — but no chords.
paragraphs.name: 499c

94cd293b45d6.title: You’re welcome to browse the code — here’s the repo that I’ve made public.

paragraphs.text: You’re welcome to browse the code — here’s the repo that I’ve made public.
https://github.com/terrenjpeterson/guitarteacher
paragraphs.name: 3e3d

paragraphs.text: Hi, Terren. Thanks for your post. Wow, I am even more impressed than ever at the lengths to which music students will go to not pay a qualified instructor for the invaluable human element of learning (/snark).
paragraphs.name: c24a

paragraphs.text: Confession: I am a music instructor and musician, so my opinion is biased that way.
paragraphs.name: 72d2

virtuals.subtitle: Confession: I am a music instructor and musician, so my opinion is biased that way.

content.subtitle: Confession: I am a music instructor and musician, so my opinion is biased that way.

paragraphs.text: Very nice!
paragraphs.name: a8a5

paragraphs.text: One thing that is missing and will be missing for a while is the constant feedback from an actual teacher on hand positioning, proper posture, proper breathing and more of the physical aspects of playing guitar that I wished that I learned or someone helped me on when I was young. Some of the bad habits I had…
paragraphs.name: a145

1b46bfedfe5c.title: Can it evaluate the quality of the music being played?

paragraphs.text: Can it evaluate the quality of the music being played? Such as recognizing a muted string in a chord, or timing issue when picking. That would be cool.
paragraphs.name: e2b6

e8c16c84a521.title: Terren, thank you for you kind response.

paragraphs.text: Terren, thank you for you kind response. I’m happy to hear that you had music in school! I did, too, in my rural Midwest school: I recall learning notes and singing as early as second grade. By fifth grade, I was playing flute, and I continued all the way through high school, learning to play sax and oboe, too!
paragraphs.name: f713

virtuals.subtitle: Now, I live in a central California town, where we have one full-time high school band director. There are other music teachers who teach…

content.subtitle: Now, I live in a central California town, where we have one full-time high school band director. There are other music teachers who teach…

1dcacdb859bb.title: This is so fabulous on so many levels.

paragraphs.text: This is so fabulous on so many levels. Musicians everywhere must be so excited. Please translate for jazz piano chords! I am delirious with joy.
paragraphs.name: 53f0

bc544a18e857.title: THIS WAS EPIC ! the devices we have at our finger tips now a days Epic read !

paragraphs.text: THIS WAS EPIC ! the devices we have at our finger tips now a days Epic read !

What a fabulous idea, Terren! I’m in user experience and just digging into how users use Alexa, what skills they are creating. I tried to learn guitar for a few years, but that hump is so hard to get over! Thanks for sharing! I‘m currently learning piano, and having a skill like that would be great there as well! :-D

1cb4897e14cc.title: It’s a good skill to have on Amazon.

paragraphs.text: It’s a good skill to have on Amazon. The intro is a bit long though. Can you reduce it? Every time I open the skill it takes about 5 seconds to start…
paragraphs.name: dc24

c96383bed334.title: Wow, things have truly changed on our planet.

paragraphs.text: Wow, things have truly changed on our planet. I taught myself to play in 1982, when I was twelve. I played until my fingers literally bled, but I was determined to be a Rock Star. I guess the only advice I can offer beginners is this: You do not have to press the strings extremely hard to the fretboard in order to produce sound, but this will become…
paragraphs.name: e2b9

197cec1fa8ce.title: Hi Terren, do you have a step by step link on how to do this project.

paragraphs.text: Hi Terren, do you have a step by step link on how to do this project. I’m also learning the guitar via YouTube. May be I can create this app
paragraphs.name: 642c

2c7980e4bd53.title: Great idea and congratulations on designing music software teaching program!

paragraphs.text: Great idea and congratulations on designing music software teaching program! I should look into finding an app for piano instructions!! Since you are at the beginning stages you do not want to become too dependent on a software program — it’s a good addition to your practice routine. It is also best to have a great guitar teacher work with you on a…
paragraphs.name: e7ca

e9771d590a35.title: The “Guitar Teacher” skill that I published out on the platform works with any device.

paragraphs.text: The “Guitar Teacher” skill that I published out on the platform works with any device. Just enable it through the skill store, and it should start working. Here’s the link to the actual app from the Amazon retail site to help.
paragraphs.name: a471

d1470aa22d6b.title: Do you have an Alexa device?

paragraphs.text: Do you have an Alexa device? The more people that use the skill and can provide feedback the better. Thank you — and mediocre guitar players unite!
paragraphs.name: d3d3

2dd34c3b3390.title: The coolest part about being a Software Engineer is solving a problem which you are facing using…

paragraphs.text:
The coolest part about being a Software Engineer is solving a problem which you are facing using your skill-set, and you just did that. 
What you have started is very Unique in its form but will require a lot of knowledge related to music theory as well as sound engineering.
I am available for all kinds of help that you need. I am too a mediocre guitar player.
paragraphs.name: fe06

paragraphs.text: Your Alexa app is awesome! I only have a suggestion for a very good App to learn an instrument. I use Yusician (http://yousician.com/) and I’m improving every day. I started with guitar, but now I’m learning piano. Give it a try ;)
paragraphs.name: 84f5

fb803601b8a2.title: The current version of the Alexa platform doesn’t provide the option to pass the raw sound data to…

paragraphs.text: The current version of the Alexa platform doesn’t provide the option to pass the raw sound data to the app, rather translates everything to text. I’m guessing that feature will eventually get added, then I can go back and add tonal analysis to what is being played to provide this type of feedback. I agree — this capability will be a good feature addition!
paragraphs.name: 549e

f1eec972bb18.title: Thanks for adding to the dialog, and great perspective.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for adding to the dialog, and great perspective. It would be great to understand your thoughts on how we change the course of music education today to be more inclusive of the full spectrum of means.

4c9efba69ce9.title: Alexa may be good for memorizing the fretboard but that’s it.

paragraphs.text: Alexa may be good for memorizing the fretboard but that’s it.
paragraphs.name: ee6e

paragraphs.text: The rest you need to learn by playing over backing tracks or jamming with other people. You need to see and play with people that are better than you are.
paragraphs.name: cc37

paragraphs.text: It’s all about developing the correct sense of timing and feel. You need to learn that from a human
paragraphs.name: f4f4
